metadata.dc:author: Miller, A
Bonasse, J
Conti-Diaz, I A
Civila, E
metadata.dc:description: A human case of cutaneous sporotrichosis with three chancriform primary lesions and regional lymphangitis is presented in a male patient infected during the hunting of armadillos. The clinical picture shows very well the usual mechanism of infection for the disease in Uruguay, which is a direct contact of man with armadillos and their burrows.
metadata.dc:title: Esporotricosis cutánea, linfangítico-nodular, con puerta de entrada múltiple.
[Cutaneous lymphangitic-nodular sporotrichosis with multiple portals of entry].
